Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved the 'extras'”
Reviews.Author: travelagentchristy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 2012 and really enjoyed the amenities of breakfast and snacks. They offer a great array of breakfast including hot food. The snack time was wonderful with cobblers, cookies and ice cream. The inside pool was sufficient. The hotel was a great location and convenient to many attractions. I like that you can access the back road to avoid the congestion on main road. The Tanger outlet mall is right behind the hotel. We could walk to go karts and other attractions. I thought the staff was outstanding and friendly. Room was updated and clean. There is a terrace on 3rd floor (?) that is great for hanging out with friends during nice weather. They don't have an outdoor pool or fitness center but you have access to amenities at their other sister properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: shoppingdiane03
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 2-night stay at this hotel. It's clean. It has a great location right by the Tanger Outlets. The evening cobbler, cookies, & ice cream were great! The breakfast was good, too. We stayed in the Executive King Bed Room. Lots of space in the room. We used the laundry facilities which came in very handy. We would stay again. Very reasonable pricing and great value!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonya S
Reviews.Content: My brother and I booked this hotel for my parents 40th wedding anniversary and they loved it so when my husband and I went to branson for a day trip we decided to stay overnight when we got down there . We got to Branson around 9 a.m and decided to go ahead and see if they had and rooms available and if we could go ahead and check in, much to our suprise they did let us check in and also told us that there was still an hour to go on the breakfast if we was interested. Our room was directly across from the breakfast room. We went shopping, ate, came back took a nice swim in the heated pool and then had ice cream and cobbler and cookies for a midnight snack at 9 p.m. loved it and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Camden Hotel Branson”
Reviews.Author: bbardley
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, staff was friendly, extra's were wonderful. Located between the 76 Strip and Tanger Outlet Mall on Tanger Blvd. Accessible without using 76 which makes for easier entrance/exit but also allows easy access to the Strip. Good breakfast and the cobbler and ice cream from 9-11 p.m. was a pleasant extra. Nice indoor pool, very good rates, would definitely recommend staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Count this review X 25”
Reviews.Author: bret k
Reviews.Content: I booked 25 rooms for 2 nights for a seminar June 2012. We were all delighted. The conference room is big (we had 30+ at the conference). The food was excellent (they partner with a 3rd party). The rooms/beds were comfortable. The free breakfast was great. Strong internet signal (free). There is a Krispy Kreme about a block away and they had plenty of donuts plus hot foods every day. The ladies were delighted because they could walk to the outlet mall to shop (about 2 blocks). I thought we got a crazy good deal on the price of the rooms and food. I was very nervous staying at a 2.5 star hotel. I usually stay at 3 or above. I've been to Branson numerous times and never stayed in a 2.5 star hotel. I also shop Tripadvisor to see other reviews. I saw this one was under new managment beginning in 2012. Buying so many rooms and the cost of breakfast I decided to take a chance after talking to managment on the phone. We couldn't have been happier. A++

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: skicat5
Reviews.Content: Great Location in middle of the Strip within walking distance to the Outlet Mall. Helpful Staff. Clean and Spacious rooms. Beds are super comfortable.Owners and staff are taking a lot of pride in this property. Can you believe they have cookies, ice cream and cobbler til 11pm?

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: stickbuc
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed an the Camden Hotel, but we have stayed in two sister motels owned by the same ownership group. Each of those were great values for the money and the Camden Hotel was no exception. The lobby and staff were inviting and the rooms were clean and updated. The beds were comfy and each room had flat screen tvs. One fo the main selling points of the Camden, as with all of it's sister motels is the whole nine yard free breakfast: eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits and gravy, fruit, cereal and various pastries and bagels. Then at night it's free cobler and ice-cream to top off a great day in Branson. All for $62.00 including tax. It has a nice large indoor pool as well. It's only 3.5 feet deep, but is great for the kids and a relaxing dip. Plus, they offer some great discounts for many of the shows and attractions in Branson. The ownership group of the Camden and it's sister motels simply know how to do business. Offer a good product at a great price, top it off with great service and you will have a winner. We highly recommend the Camden and it's associated motels.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend "getaway"”
Reviews.Author: Doug N Vera M
Reviews.Content: Friday, July 20 was my wife's birthday. She suggested that we "getaway" for the weekend and go to Branson. We have always stayed at Branson's Best on Green Mountain Drive but we could not get reservations. The Associate suggested Camden so we stayed there. We were very pleased with all aspects of our stay. Service was excellent, the room was immaculate, breakfast was great, the cobbler, (as usual) was outstanding and I might add was one of the reasons we first came back to your chain of hotels. The service and cordiality of your employees was wonderful and they went above and beyond what I normally expect from a fine hotel. I guess you have gathered that we were very satisfied with all aspects of your establishment and when we return we will stay in one of your hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Sandra E
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms clean and comfortable. The front desk went out of their way to accommodate me when choosing my show tickets. Out shower did not have much pressure and when we saw the maintence men working in the area we asked them to check it out. They did and replaced the shower head within minutes. Great breakfast and late night snack. It's a great location right in the center of all the action. And if you like to shop there is a outlet mall steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: maranantha
Reviews.Content: My children and grandchildren stayed here with us on Memorial Day weekend for the first time. The location was great, walking distance to Tanger Mall. The breakfast was amazing, and the evening desserts were fun to look forward to. The indoor pool was so clean and had cute wall pictures. The grandsons loved it. The rooms were clean with new comfortable beds and flat screen tvs. High speed internet allowed my daughter to get some work done. We look forward to staying here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it--can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: We visit Branson about four times a year. We stayed at the Camden in April and returned Memorial Day weekend with our children and grandchildren. Camden is a new property for this management, and is their fifth motel. We have stayed at each of them and find them all to be very clean and well managed. Camden is in the process of being updated and will soon have new carpet and furniture. It is a great location, and the breakfast and evening snacks can not be beat. The indoor pool was great for our grandchildren, and I appreciate the inside corridors and elevators. The only negative I found was the female assistant manager who was unable to keep details straight and appeared to be quite unfriendly. I would recommend that she be assigned a job where she does not have to interact with guests. Gary, the manager, and Kieth, the general manager, were both very accommodating and tried to make things the best possible for the guests. The breakfast room attendants were very nice and did an excellent job of keeping all the food replenished. There was an endless supply of Krispy Cream donuts! We were very happy staying at this motel, and plan to stay there again when we return to Branson. We like to stay in a motel that is clean, well maintained, a good value, and has a friendly staff, so we will be returning to the Camden Hotel in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Minor problems + unfriendly management = probably not again!”
Reviews.Author: Nomad062_10
Reviews.Content: The Camden Hotel is an inexpensive option for lodging near the strip in Branson. The rooms are very plain, but the mattresses very comfortable and the sheets were fresh and comfortable. Standard hotel breakfast was made more special with the addition of Krispie Kreme donuts. Late evening reception provides a nice snack after the shows. Our room and the rooms of our family members were all in need of new carpeting as the carpet was dirty and frayed. Housekeeping was not quite detailed oriented as we found Dorito crumbs and a cigarette lighter under one of the bed skirts. Alarm clocks did not work, but evening staff was very cheerful about setting a wake-up call for us. Air conditioning did not work on the first day/night of our stay, but we mentioned it and were quite comfortable for the rest of the stay. Up until the time I went to check out, I had weighed the pro's and con's and landed on judging that I would stay at this hotel again. However, at check-out, I was very disappointed in the customer service skills of the female assistant manager. I had noticed earlier in the morning that she had left an elderly couple standing at the desk for a while before finally dismissing them saying that she had already addressed their issue. The couple then pointed out that she still hadn't given them a key, which she then handed them and sent them on their way. I had hoped this was an isolated incident of "uninterested" customer service. But when I approached the desk later, she did not look up and did not acknowledge me until I spoke. She still didn't make eye contact with me, didn't ask about my stay, just pulled my slip and said that she had documented that I was extending my stay. I replied that only one of the three rooms was extending the stay and that the other two were checking out on time. I noted for her the room numbers of the two rooms leaving and the room number of the people who were staying additional days. She acknowledged what I had said, but still didn't look at me, didn't smile, didn't thank me. Later that day, the party that had booked additional days called me to say that the desk had no idea they were staying additional days, and said that I had told the assistant manager that they were leaving today, as well. It is one thing to be poorly organized, but to not accept responsibility for your mistakes and actually blame another guest when mistakes are made is really poor customer service. That coupled with the fact that the woman who was quick to point out that she was an assistant manager missed all the basics of good customer service: acknowledging the presence of a guest at the desk, smiling, asking how they can help, checking to make sure the guest is satisfied, and thanking the guest for their patronage, really soured my view of the hotel. There are more hotel rooms in Branson than one can count, and I will try another hotel the next time I come to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Reunion of Old Comrades in Arms”
Reviews.Author: patjohn5555
Reviews.Content: The Camden was ideal for our group. Many of us are retired and/or on limited incomes. It was easy on the budget and everything was provided on site through convention planners & services. The rooms were clean and the service was outstanding...comparable to a much more expensive accommodation. The staff were particularly friendly and helpful, from Gary at the desk to the crew that sat up the meeting rooms. Did I mention the meeting rooms? Clean, electronics worked nicely, quiet and arrangements on time and correct. For those in our group with children, the hotel was very accommodating and the kids enjoyed their stay very much. The breakfast that went with the reservation was hearty, fresh and very popular. The dessert in the evening was nice to meet with small groups or one-on-one. A really good value, whether just for a visit to Branson's attractions, or, like us, a reunion of old friends and comrades.

Reviews.Title: “loved my stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbara b
Reviews.Content: my stay of 3 nights at this hotel was great. the room was very clean and the breakfast was a nice treat as was the cobbler and ice cream & cookies that were served in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Waited until we showed up to back out of contract!”
Reviews.Author: DoreneH_12
Reviews.Content: If you really want the room and amenities that you contracted for, stay away from this hotel. Our card group contracted for rooms at a certain rate and the use of one meeting room w/ refrigerator, round tables for 10, tablecloths, etc. When individuals made room reservations, the hotel was familiar w/ our group name, the dates and room rate contracted for. However, when we showed up, they stated they had no contract for the meeting room and other amenities. The contract was presented to them but they refused to honor it. They would not allow use of the small room off their breakfast area stating they needed it for overflow. Their best offer was moving us to another of their properties at a reduced room rate with use of the public “breakfast/evening dessert” area at the 2nd property. At the 2nd property the common area was on the 2nd floor and bathroom on the 1st floor – no elevators which was a problem for those of us with bad knees; there were 3 round plastic tables that sat 4-5 people, 1 square 4 person table and a number of small 2-person tables that had to be pushed together; we had to buy a tablecloth to make a smooth top for card playing; the pool was empty (we could drive to the original property to use that pool – not very convenient to drive back wet!). We're all from out of state so they knew we weren't going to take them to court.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: 139 carmel valley way st robert, mo
Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Baymont17871
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Camden hotel for 2 nights--4/16 and 4/17. Staff was excellant, rooms cleaner than clean! Nice BIG breakfast each morning. A BIG plus---nightly cobbler and ice cream from 9 to 11 each night--WOW. If you go to Branson this is one of the best places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- New Name- Camden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 53Frosty53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Camden Hotel(formerly called Cobblestone) for three nights. The room was immaculate, new bedding, new sheets, The staff was excellent. They were very helpful and responded quickly to our requests!! They had a wonderful breakfast (complete with sausage gravy and biscuit, krispy kreme doughnuts, eggs, oatmeal, juice, cereal, fruit, toast, and the list goes on!!) They have coffee, cappucino, and hot chocolate 24 hours a day. At night after the shows there was yummy blackberry and peach cobbler- with soft serve ice cream. Also, they had an assortment of cookies. They are remodeling the hotel, but you are not bothered by that at all because they have this building complete!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Branson. It was very close to shopping, shows, and restaurants. We loved the inside entrances to the rooms- we did not even have to use our heat in our room and it was in the 20's outside, so we were just very comfortable in all aspects of our stay there!! If having krispy kreme doughnuts for breakfast is not enough- it is located at the top of the hill and you can just stop by for hot doughnuts as you wish!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 4”
Reviews.Author: Nancy L
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with all aspects of this trip. A young man named Aaron was especially nice and helpful. Great breakfast! Hot cobbler and ice cream every night. Nov 14th - 18th. Would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worse service in my life!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy417
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Branson for our Anniversary like we always do. We stayed at the Cobblestone Inn like we have been doing for a while now. When we checked in the clerk said the computers were down so we needed to come in sometime the next day to fill out paper work. We paid with cash for two nights. She even took our credit card info to keep on file in case something happened to the room. She wrote down our room number gave us our keys and we were on our way. We unloaded our stuff into the room and were looking online for stuff to do. Within 10 minutes a worker unlocked our door and walked in on us!!! Rediculous I know, but we let it pass. Around 8:30 a.m. our 1st morning we hear a knock on the door even though we had do not disturb sign up. Once again the knocked this time I answered(my husband was in the bath) and may I note that if I hadn't deadbolted the door and chain locked it they would've walked in on us AGAIN!!! They kept trying to unlock the door with their key!!! I was so furious when I opened the door to them. There was a dude with a ball cap on and a beer t-shirt standing there with a lady.This dude with the ball cap and beer shirt was the manager!Sure couldn't tell by what he was wearing. For all I knew he was a guest! He said we have no record of you guys being here or paying what time did you arrive yesterday. I said I don't know but we did pay! We paid for 2 nights!!! He said well we have no record of you being here. I said well that's not my problem that's yours!! He acted as if we were some kind of genius criminals who can make those little credit card key things to get into the room. Ya like heaven forbid his workers would mess up. It had to be us! I was so furious! So was my husband! Never have we ever been treated like that by a business before in our lives!! When my husband went to the front desk to give them a piece of his mind they were not even apologetic when the finally realized they were at fault and the computers were down the day before. They clerk must have made the mistake of not making note that we HAD checked in and HAD paid! UGH! So ya we do not recommend this hotel under andy circumstances!!! Bad service!!!

Reviews.Title: “we very much enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: setfreeatlast7777
Reviews.Content: we brought my inlaws to branson as they had not been there in over 26 yrs. they are both handicapped. so we got the handicapped room and it accomadated us very well. the staff was very friendly and helpful. i liked the fact it was off the strip and out of all the busy streets. thank you all. and we will be visiting this motel again. for an older place it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: motraveler86
Reviews.Content: The rooms were old and the linens were dirty. The breakfast is very lacking. There was not much to chose from. The adveritisement says that there is an indoor pool, but it is in a different building. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jubu01
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary of staying at this hotel due to the reviews that were written about it. I had a different experience. The hotel is an older one and there were some repairs needed but it was clean and quiet. I was there for a convention and it was very convenient to stay at the hotel and have the use of their banquet room. The staff that I encountered were friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickey0513
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson for 3 nights with 3 children under 10. This was an older hotel that really needs a little updating. It was nothing spectacular. Can't give it a poor rating in anyway but certainly can't give it anything higher than an average rating. We made a reservation with a credit card because we knew we would be getting into town late. When we weren't there by 9 pm the front desk guy called to see if we were still coming - thought this was a little weird as no other hotel has ever done this when we have arrived late. We arranged for a "family unit" and I got 3 rooms that connected with an inner door. Website did not mention the "family unit" to be 3 rooms so I told the guy at the desk I didn't need 3 rooms - only 2 - so I did get a lower rate on the 2 rooms than I originally was quoted. The rooms were nothing to great but the beds were comfortable and the AC worked even though they were the window type units stuck in a whole in the wall. We did not eat the free continental breakfast as it was very "cheap" - boxed donuts, oatmeal packets right from the box, etc. Hotel was conveniently located on the main strip near shopping, shows and restaurants. Pool was nice in the fact that with 3 small children who are not strong swimmers, the entire pool was 3 feet deep - I know this would not appeal to some people but it worked well for us - my husband and I could sit at the pool side instead of being in the pool with the kids. Pool area was very outdated, cobwebs in every corner, old carpet that needed repair. I was surprised it had free wireless internet. We probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay There”
Reviews.Author: car123arkansas
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and our two daughters (ages9 & 13) stayed the weekend at Cobblestone Inn. The rooms were ok, except not the cleanest we had been in. My husband found juice bottles by the night stand in the room, which obviously had been left there by the person who stayed before us because we didn't have any there. However, we thought that for no more time than we would be spending in the hotel it would be fine. We didn't really like the fact that everything was in separate buildings. We had to do alot of walking to get to the pool/hot tub area, the breakfast area, and the front desk. Anyway, the real thing that upset me about this hotel was 2 days after we left I happened to be checking my bank account online, and they had charged extra money to my debit card. When I called the hotel to find out what it was for the lady told me that the maid reported that the matress in our room was soaking wet & smelled like urine. After 10 minutes of trying to convince this manager person that there is no way this was true, considering my daughters outgrew wetting the bed years ago, I asked that the owners call me so we could try to work this out. She informed me that when you check into the hotel you sign a paper and at the bottom of that paper it states that your credit card can be charged for any damages to the room, so there was nothing I could do about it, and that the she would leave my number for the owners to call me, and of course they never did, so the next morning I called back and requested to speak to the owners again and was told by this same manager that she gave them the message and they said they would not call me that they are allowed to charge for any damages and that is what they are doing. So my $89 weekend stay ended up costing me hundreds of dollars. For the price they charged me I could have stayed in one of the finest hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Texas073
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very conveniently located and a great value. It is walking distance from several attractions and restaurants including Moon River Grill, Tanger Outlet Mall, Denny's, Ride The Ducks, Baldnobbers Jamboree, Peppercorns, and more. The only negative thing about the hotel is that it is not all under one roof. So, the indoor pool and hot tub are in one building with the lobby, the breakfast and laundry facility is in another building, and the rooms are divided into several buildings. We had to walk outside in the rain to get to the pool and hot tub. Also the hot tub is very small and was not working during our visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Camden Hotel and Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 275 Tanger Boulevard, Branson, MO 65616 (Formerly Cobblestone Inn & Conference Center)
